Lighting setup @danartriatmojo 
#xendit #hbrmagazine

post2.caption: Portrait of Wayan Sudarsana, left, and Nyoman Dena, right, beach daybed renter at Geger Beach, in Nusa Dua. Geger is one of the few public access to the beach on the strip that is occupied with 5-stars hotels & resorts. Second picture is a privatized land at Batu Tampih beach, Tabanan. #tourismworkerportraits

post3.caption:
When I began photographing personal diary during the pandemic called “INSIDE”, I would never thought that I someday will photograph literally when I was sick of COVID-19. I have been diligent, and successfully dodged it for more than two years, until two weeks ago. As a person living with MPN, I found myself torn into two: one that thought, this is it you will be clotting and die, and the other said, NOT TODAY. Two weeks later, and some of the weirdest symptoms ever—itching skin with no marks or rash, irregular heartbeat, decrease and increasing platelets. I’m still here. 

The last chapter. @thejournal_collective

post4.caption:
Ketut Artayasa and Gede Sudarma has been working as a lifeguard for at least a decade in Double Six Beach. I created a portrait series of Tourism Workers for ObscuraDao NFT project “The World Today” comission. This project consists 138 photographers from around the world taking a visual time stamp of the 21st century. Cities, towns, farms, landscapes, communities, people and events that will tell the story of our world for centuries to come. An ode to the 20th century project, The Family of man, by legendary curator Edward Steichen for the MoMA exhibition, The World Today uses the technology of NFTs to create a permanent record through the blockchain of our world.

Lighting assistant @danartriatmojo

post5.caption:
30 years young. 
When you have a career in life, people love to define them and single them out into one thing, putting them in a box of categories. There is no single thing that can define me because as a human, I'm so much more than that.

I created a series of self-portraits, representing multi facades and the complexity of my identity, in the social context that restricts me, at the same time, giving me the freedom to explore.

 #SelfPortrait 

Lighting man: @danartriatmojo who always ready for an impromptu session. 💡

post6.caption:
Self portrait with the pandemic Kale, 2022.

In honor of the 2 years old kale, grown from seeds at the beginning of the pandemic. Even though only live in a long pot container, you have grown, long, and prosperous, never give up in giving. Thank you for so many bowls of salads, sauted vegs, and tasty omelette. You fed me when I was hungry, now it’s time for you to rest.

post7.caption: “When the sun lovers are gone under the roof, the sea unfolds and wraps the loner under her silence." 2018

post8.caption:
After two years break from freediving, I came back to Tulamben in December last year to accompany @pishiyoga  finally getting her course session with @agushong. So happy!!!

All footages recorded by @agushong edited by me. 🌹✨🧜‍♀️ #freediving

post10.caption:
Happy to be included in @womenphotograph 2021 Year in Pictures curated by @tanvimishra. 

In this picture, a tender moment as Aurel bathes on the ocean with her dog during sunset at Rote Island, East Nusa Tenggara, Indonesia.

Tanvi Mishra wrote—As we collectively continue to battle COVID-19, widespread political unrest, and mounting climate catastrophe, this collection once again feels like a reflection of a dark, challenging year — but not without its fair share of softer and more contemplative moments that offer a glimpse into some of the select silver linings of a pandemic that has continued to allow us more time at home and with loved ones.”

post11.caption:
Portrait of Sari Luh at a spa Ketut Purna owned in Nusa Dua. Mr. Purna’s businesses hit hard by pandemic, as he has shut his travel agent office and one of his spas permanently and sold cars and land to settle debts. He is paying only nine of his previous 300 employees, and Sari Luh is one of them. She works two days every week as a masseuse, which total six days a month.

For @wsj @wsjphotos. Story written by Jonathan Emont

Lighting assistant @danartriatmojo

post3.caption:
Everything is moving, everything is shifting. Like Kristin Amstrong said, the only way to counteract chaos is stillness. 
Pushing #GalaxyS9 boundaries (a.k.a disiksa), shooting slow-motion on a dark underwater.

Mermaid: @trotoar_malam #WithGalaxy #EpicJourney @samsung_id

post4.caption:
Freediving in Indonesia wasn't as popular popular back then on 2012-2013. If you've been on Instagram during that time, you must've known that @danartriatmojo is probably one of the few who influence people to explore what's beyond the horizon through this platform. He introduced me to the ocean and the love for it has never been stop growing since.

This fun session freediving video is tribute to his positive influence towards loving the ocean means wholeheatedly trying to protect it.

Disclaimer: Freediving is considered an extreme sport. Please do not practice without assistance. Rule no #1 : Never freedive alone!

Song: DJ Quads - Breathing

post5.caption:
Most of the times we overlooked things, beautiful small little things happen in our life because we strive towards perfection everyday. Sometimes we only want people to see our 'perfect' selves, as we locked away our flaws. We strictly edited what we want to show to the platform, without noticing we lost our true self in the process.
.
Here's to an uncontrollable laugh, broken teeth, sore feet, rusty vehichle and unapologetic headbang. Fleeting moments @danartriatmojo and I had last weekend. Shot #withgalaxy #GalaxyS9
.
Post your #WithGalaxy on your own amazing Super Slow-Mo shots!
.
Music by DJ Quads-The Improv

post7.caption: Bell rings as a call for prayer at the Old Church of Banda in Banda Naira island, Central Maluku. The church known for its floor, which used tombstone from Dutch soldier who died during war to rule the islands for spices. @thebandajournal #thebandajournal #documentary

post8.caption: A fisherman catches fishes near Taman Wisata Pantai Banda as rain is approaching the island. @thebandajournal #documentary #NLLDTABanda
